overview_of_class: Principles of Irreversible Thermodynamics; Driving Forces and Fluxes; Diffusion in the Presence of Stress; Diffusion Resulting from other Gradients; Diffusion Resulting from Discrete Jumps; Diffusion in Crystals; Diffusion Controlled versus Source/Sink Controlled Kinetics; Surface Rearrangements by Evaporation and Condensation; Coarsening of Microstructures due to Capillary Forces; Growth of Phases in Concentration Gradients; Growth of Phases in Thermal Gradients; Evaporation of Metal Crystals; Vapor-Liquid-Solid (VLS) Growth Mechanism of the Growth of Nanowires.
name: Kinetics
title: MEAS MAT_SCI 416-0-20 Kinetics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Principles of Irreversible Thermodynamics; Driving Forces and Fluxes; Diffusion in the Presence of Stress; Diffusion Resulting from other Gradients; Diffusion Resulting from Discrete Jumps; Diffusion in Crystals; Diffusion Controlled versus Source/Sink Controlled Kinetics; Surface Rearrangements by Evaporation and Condensation; Coarsening of Microstructures due to Capillary Forces; Growth of Phases in Concentration Gradients; Growth of Phases in Thermal Gradients; Evaporation of Metal Crystals; Vapor-Liquid-Solid (VLS) Growth Mechanism of the Growth of Nanowires.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: MSE 401 or consent of the instructor

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two lectures per week. Students are expected and encouraged to ask questions and participate in discussion during class. The solution of problems is an essential part of this course.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be two examinations and the homework will be graded.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: "Kinetic Processes in Materials," by R. W. Balluffi, S. M. Allen, and W. Craig Carter (Wiley-VCH).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
1. "Diffusion in Solids," Martin E. Glicksman (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 2000).

2. "Atom Movements: Diffusion and Mass Transport in Solids," Jean Philibert, (Les Editions de Physique, Avenue du Hogar, Zone Industrielle de Courtaboeuf, B.P. 112, F-91944 Les Ulis Cedex A, France).
